alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 16 at 3:30AM CST until February 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and north central and west central Illinois. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A change from rain to mixed precipitation will occur late tonight, becoming all snow by mid morning Thursday. The heaviest snow accumulation will be from mid morning through the afternoon on Thursday. The higher snowfall amounts are most favored across the southern portions of the warning area. Heavy rates of snowfall greater than one inch per hour are possible. This combined with winds gusting as high as 35 mph could result in difficult travel conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
